title.narrative: QUALITY AND INCLUSIVE LEARNING - PRIMARY

description.narrative: Government authorities have strengthened capacity to improve the system for quality, equitable and inclusive education, including the development of social and emotional skills (Basic Education), which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Cross Sectoral - Children With Disabilities, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement (Covid), Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023, more children and adolescents, especially the most disadvantaged, have improved education and learning outcomes.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Government authorities have strengthened capacity to improve the system for quality, equitable and inclusive education, including the development of social and emotional skills (Basic Education)

description.narrative:
For almost two schoolyears in-person classes were disrupted and distance learning modalities implemented. Surveys indicated concerns for learning loss. NEDA estimated potential wage loss of Php 11 trillion over next 40 years. Advocacy for safe school reopening resulted to positive actions, with the President approving pilot-run in 100 schools then extended to 287. UNICEF’s role as GPE Grant Agent helped enhance equity focus in the development of Education Sector Plan. The use of SEA-PLM learning assessment and ECE longitudinal research to informed learning recovery agenda, priority for WASH in schools, support to digital learning and equity focus on disadvantaged learners.

| Status:Constrained | As-of Date:22/12/2021
